jcr:content.jcr:description: With Altra, you can get you the gear you need to get out and conquer cold conditions. Here are the best running shoes for snowy or slippery winter conditions.
jcr:content.jcr:title: Win your winter with the right winter shoes
jcr:content.pageTitle: Win your winter with the right winter shoes

text_copy_copy_copy_.text: WIN YOUR WINTER WITH THE RIGHT WINTER SHOES

text_copy_copy_copy.text: Let’s face it: winter weather makes it more difficult to get out and run due to the less-than-ideal running conditions. The good news is, we can help. As they say, “there’s no such thing as bad weather. Just bad gear.” So, let’s get you the gear you need to get out and conquer those cold conditions.

image.alt: Altra shoes for running on snow
Altra King MT 2 Heavy Traction Shoe
Altra Olympus 3.5 High Cushion Running Shoe

text.text:
Conditions: Snowy, icy, slippery or muddy

Recommended Tech: Vibram® MegaGrip™ Outsole

Reasoning: Vibram® MegaGrip™ is exactly as advertised: mega grippy. Even in wet or slippery conditions, it is durable and provides excellent grip, performing well in the cold. 

Suggested Shoes: For technical terrain, we recommend the King MT 2. For longer runs on snowy roads, go with the Olympus 3.5. 

*Looking for even more traction? Every pair of Altra trail shoes is compatible with most aftermarket ice spikes, so you can handle any icy adventure.

image.alt: Running and walking shoes for cold conditions and deep snow
Altra Lone Peak 4 RSM Rain Snow Mud

text_copy.text:
Conditions: Deep snow, cold and wet 

Recommended Tech: RSM (Rain, Snow, Mud)

Reasoning: Our RSM technology features a breathable upper designed to keep your feet warm and comfortable whether you’re running in rain, snow, mud, or a mix of the three.

Suggested Shoes: For winter trail running, the Lone Peak RSM is your shoe. If you prefer winter hiking, the Lone Peak Mid RSM is the way to go.

image.alt: Altra running and walking shoes for frozen ground
Altra Lone Peak 4.5 Mid Hiking Shoe
Altra Lone Peak 4 Mid Hiking Shoe

text_copy_copy.text:
Conditions: Packed snow, frozen/dry ground

Recommended Tech: MaxTrac Outsole, find this on the Lone Peak 4.5 Low

Reasoning: Both durable and sticky, the MaxTrac outsole has a multi-directional lug pattern that provides grippy traction on any terrain, even when it’s cold and frozen.

Recommended Tech: DuraTread™ Outsole, find this on the Lone Peak 4 Mid

Reasoning: The DuraTread™ outsole offers a durable rubber with great grip for any hiking condition.

Suggested Shoes: The Lone Peak collection is a great all-around choice for these conditions.  

*Looking for even more traction? Every pair of Altra trail shoes is compatible with most aftermarket ice spikes, so you can handle any icy adventure.

Conditions: Hiking, wet and snowy terrain

Recommended Tech: DuraTread™ Outsole and RSM (Rain, Snow, Mud) Upper

Reasoning: The DuraTread™ outsole offers a durable rubber with great grip for any hiking condition while the RSM upper is breathable, keeping your feet warm and comfortable in the elements.

Suggested Shoes: The Lone Peak 4 Mid RSM gives you everything the Lone Peak 4 Mid gives you with added winter hiking protection.
